item.title: A Boy and His Dream
item.description:
The beginning of a new song and an ASCII art music video.



LYRICS:

I hear it in your voice
I see it in your eyes
If they got any brighter
It would look like a sunrise
How could I say anything but, "that's great"
With that smile on your face

But why does it still hurt
Why do I care
Why do I find myself wishing you were still here
After you told me all about your dream like it was all you could see
And this girl wouldn't want to get between
A boy and his dream

item.title: Cycle Cycle Cyc
item.description: Some friends rode in the Salt to Saint Utah Bicycle Relay, so Kärstin and Kamie wrote this song for them and sang it at The Songwriting School of Los Angeles' open mic.

item.title: America the Beautiful
item.description:
A good friend, Kärstin Lake, and I have been talking about collaborating for a while. She played this arrangement of America the Beautiful in church on Sept. 11 and I wanted to sing something patriotic this week, so this was the perfect opportunity!

I have a hard time relating to some of the lyrics from Katharine Bates’ poem written in 1911, so I took creative liberty and made it more relatable.



LYRICS:

I see spacious skies
Past the power lines
And stores stocked with food
Mountain majesties
Feel like home to me
I know there so much more here I don't see

But I know we have a lot
And we want a lot
And we work a lot
But where is our heart where is our soul
In the moments that write the story of our
Home of the brave and land of the free

Trying to be great
And live what we believe
Some serve
Some take a knee
Just please don't feed me
Rubbish sleaze
I can't respect a political disease

Oh, America, America
God shed his grace on thee
And crown thy good with brotherhood
For all humanity!

item.title: Put Your Records On
item.description: This week Kamie got a Novation LaunchPad to work on beats and have been in the studio recording samples for a new song she is working on!... BUT since it isn't ready yet, this week she is covering Corinne Bailey Rae's Put Your Records On. It has a great groove.

item.title: Gone Gone Gone
item.description: Seeing Phillip Phillips and his band play a few weeks ago nudged Kamie to transition from conceptualizing to doing. She decided to cover one of his well-loved songs this week and give him and his band a shout out and a thank you!

item.title: 200 OK
item.description:
A JavaScript inspired song that Kamie wrote making it's open mic debut at The Songwriting School of Los Angeles.



LYRICS:

Hello
var Kamie;
Treat me like an object and I won't call back
What's that?
You think I'm funny
I think I'm okay with that

CHORUS:
If you query me about who I am
I'll return enough to make you think
Query me about where I've been
I'll serve up sweet stories
Query me about my plans
I'll return an array of possibilities
You say you want to be a part of them
It's 200 OK with me.

I think too much I'm always mulling it over
You're plagued with anxiety
But when it slips your mind and you focus in real time
I wish you could see what I see

CHORUS

A little bridge nudge followed by an exuberant gush
And a detailed explanation of
What befuddled you for a while
Then a question or a gaze
Asking for my take
That look on your face
I can't help but smile

CHORUS

item.title: What makes employees smile at TowerJazz
item.description:
To celebrate TowerJazz reaching a $1 billion run rate, employees were asked what they like about working at the company and what makes them smile. Here are a few of their answers.

Kamie worked on the concept for this video with Ela Pappo and Felize Richens then shot and edited it for the celebration.

item.title: Additive Color Game
item.description:
Taylor Nelson, Joshua Chavez and Kamie came up with this mix-and-match color game to passively teach additive color theory.

Players swipe a red, green or blue square into another square to combine them to make a secondary or tertiary color. (If you are on a computer, click the first square, then the second.) You earn points if you get two matching secondary or tertiary colors next to each other!

The goal is to see how many points you can get before time runs out.


The MVP from Angel Hack LA in May 2014. Taylor, Josh and Kamie jointly worked on the concept. Taylor headed the dev. Kamie mocked up the design.

item.title: Symmetrica
item.description:
Symmetrica is based on Rorschach ink blot tests. Designer Richard Blake developed five laser cut headpieces to examine the fusion of fashion, graphic design, and psychology. Symmetrica aims to highlight human features through dimensional wearable sculptures and emphasize awareness to the individual guise.

Kamie photographed the pieces for Richard. The photos were selected to be included in this book, Making a Splash: Graphics that Flow.

item.title: A Laser Cut Record
item.description:
In grad school, Kamie and Amy Lee started Cheeky Bean Studio to talk through creative ideas and work on projects and emerging mediums. Here is one of their experiments based on an Instructables tutorial: Laser Cut Record.


At the Maryland Institute College of Art (MICA) in the fabrication studio making the final cut!!



We chose the song, Somewhere Over the Rainbow by IZ. It doesn't sound pleasant, but you can kind of hear the ukulele. Next time we will better prepare the board making it slimmer, flatter, smoother and etch the grooves deeper.

Special thanks to Mrs. Walton for letting us put the needle on the "record"!!
